Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
We appreciate your interest in Film Camp. Due to the increase in the number of students at BYU-Idaho, our department resources are being reassigned to other areas. We will no longer be able to offer many of the programs that we used to provide.  Read Letter to the Community for more information.

We would like to thank you for your past support of our programs. We have had many enjoyable years and appreciate the contributions and value that you brought to our programs. If you are still interested in this type of program, we suggest that you look for other alternatives provided by BYU-Idaho or the community.

What is Film Camp?

BYU-Idaho Youth Film Camp is a fun and interactive camp that seeks to teach how to communicate through media and develop leadership and teamwork skills. Daily workshops will integrate lessons on story development, acting, filming, and editing. Devotionals will help participants contribute to media while maintaining a gospel perspective. Youth will learn these lessons as they are taught through the BYU-Idaho learning model, which incorporates three basic concepts: preparing to be instructed, having students teach one another, and proving or demonstrating what they have learned through the final film production

  • Make your own inspirational short film
  • Storyboard presentations
  • Acting lessons
  • Filming techniques
  • Media and gospel devotionals
  • Red carpet award ceremony

Information Packet

Who: Youth ages 14 – 18.

Cost: $330. Price covers lunch, dinner, workshops, and activities. ($100 housing option, breakfast included.)

Note: Counselors and instructors are selected from BYU-Idaho students. Participants will be expected to abide by the BYU-Idaho Honor Code.

Roommate and Group Requests

To request a roommate please include the program, session, your name and age, and the name and age of your desired roommate. Include the same information to request to be in the same group as a person of a different gender. This information may be entered in during the registration process or afterward by sending an email to youthprograms@byui.edu.
Community Connections' tries to accommodate all requests, but reserves the right to make assignments according to the needs of the program.

Travel Options

Be aware of which session you are attending. Make sure your travel plans match the program dates and times. If you are traveling by plane, you should fly into the Salt Lake City Airport or Idaho Falls Airport and arrange for a shuttle to take you to Rexburg.

BYU-Idaho Shuttle Service

Community Connections offers a shuttle service between the Idaho Falls Airport and the BYU-Idaho campus for participants arriving by plane.

Arrival Shuttles (Idaho Falls Airport Only)

  • Monday - 12:30 p.m.

Departure Shuttles (Idaho Falls Airport Only)

  • Saturday - 5:30 p.m.

Shuttle fees are $20 per person each way. The deadline for shuttle reservations is one week prior to the program start date. A reservation is required to ensure shuttle service.

Shuttle Service from Salt Lake City, Utah

  • The Salt Lake Express runs shuttles daily from Salt Lake City and Rexburg. If you choose this option select the shuttle that arrives at 12:35 p.m. on Monday in Rexburg.
  • A discount is available through the Salt Lake Express simply enter in ZAFY12 in the discount code box. (In order for the discount to apply you must leave either from the LDS Conference Center or Airport.)
  • On Friday the Salt Lake Express has a shuttle that leaves BYU-Idaho at 2:00 p.m. arriving in Salt Lake around 7 p.m.
  • Salt Lake Express Website

Refund Policy:

A $25 processing fee will be assessed for each refund. All refund requests received less than three weeks prior to the program start date will incur an additional $75 processing fee, for a total of $100. No refund will be granted if the request is made within one week of the starting date.
If circumstances require a participant to switch to another week, a $25 processing fee will be assessed.
Disclaimer: We reserve the right to make changes to any policy or procedure at any time without notice. Additionally, we reserve the right to refuse service or entrance to any person for any reason.
